The Nikon NIKKOR Z 24-120mm f/4 S lens is a very useful wide-angle to short-telephoto zoom lens that can be used for a broad range of purposes, including landscape and portrait photography. It is a genuinely adaptable everyday lens. Throughout the zoom range, the lens's constant f/4 maximum aperture provides continuous performance, and its sophisticated optical design ensures excellent clarity and sharpness. This lens is a standard for most purposes and is lightweight and relatively small in size.

Optical Design

With three ED elements, one aspherical ED element, and three aspherical elements of Nikon NIKKOR Z 24-120mm lens combined, chromatic and spherical aberrations are successfully removed providing remarkable clarity and sharpness across the zoom range. When working in bright lighting and backlit circumstances, ARNEO and Nano Crystal Coats are utilized to eliminate ghosting, reflections, and flare in order to obtain increased contrast and clarity.

Autofocus and Vibration Reduction

A synchronized pair of independent AF drive units are incorporated into the multi-focus system to provide exceptionally quick and precise focusing across the zoom range. Stepping motors of Nikon NIKKOR Z 24-120mm lens, which are used in this system, provide remarkably quiet and smooth autofocus performance that is ideal for both photo and video applications.

Professional Handling and Design

Control via Programming Rings can be used to adjust exposure compensation, ISO, or aperture. The assignable L.Fn button provides seamless points for rapidly adjusting exposure settings and other operations when used in conjunction with camera-based Fn buttons. The Nikon NIKKOR Z 24-120mm lens performs better in bad weather thanks to its front fluorine coating and dust- and moisture-resistant lens barrel.

full_description:
Nikon NIKKOR Z 400mm f/4.5 VR S Lens

The NIKKOR Z 400mm f/4.5 VR S is a super-telephoto prime lens that combines exceptional mobility with long reach, cutting-edge optics, and suitable AF and VR. It is the smallest and lightest 400mm lens that Nikon has ever produced. This versatile lens is ideal for sports or wildlife photographers who are on-the-go and need a handheld setup with a long enough reach to capture images of far-off subjects.

Autofocus and Vibration Reduction

The Stepping motors of NIKKOR Z 400mm are used in the advanced autofocus technology to provide fast and precise focusing performance as well as silent, smooth AF that is ideal for both image and video applications. In order to retain the overall length of the lens during use and to encourage faster focusing speeds, an internal focusing design is adopted, where only the internal lens groups are altered while focusing. Full-time manual focus override is also possible.

Professional Handling and Construction

The tripod foot that comes with the device is readily detachable, contributing to its lightweight and agile design, making it perfect for handheld use. When shooting handheld or using a tripod or monopod, the physical design of NIKKOR Z 400mm directs the center of gravity toward the back of the lens, around the tripod mount, for smoother, more responsive panning. In order to facilitate the transition between shooting in vertical and horizontal orientations, the tripod mount also rotates. The intuitive "no-look" control layout keeps your eyes off the viewfinder by placing all of the frequently used buttons and knobs in convenient places.

full_description:
Nikon NIKKOR Z 28mm f/2.8 SE Lens

The Nikon NIKKOR Z 28mm f/2.8 (SE) FX-format prime lens is ultra-compact and lightweight, with a typical Nikon heritage design. This Special Edition lens is inspired by the vintage NIKKOR lenses launched around the same time as the Nikon FM2 film SLR camera, with elements such as knurling and a prominent control ring that authentically mimic the designs of the time. The lens is intended to be a flexible wide-angle lens suitable for a variety of topics such as landscape, architectural, and reportage. This quick, bright lens with an f/2.8 maximum aperture provides stunning details at a normal focal length. In addition to the optical design, a multi-focus system with two stepping motors aids in achieving extremely quick, precise, and silent focus performance, as well as full-time manual focus override for both stills and video applications. A programmable control ring may also be configured for straightforward modification of a number of camera and exposure parameters. It's a terrific lens to have on hand for unplanned situations at any time of day.

Autofocus Features

Two fast-stepping autofocus motors work almost silently. The internal focus lens has a rear-focus design that separates the components into specialized lens groups for focusing, with just the rear lens group moving for quicker, smoother operation. The focus groups' positions are accurately regulated, resulting in exceptionally accurate and fast AF control.

Multi-Focus System

The focus groups' positions are accurately regulated, resulting in exceptionally accurate and fast AF control. Furthermore, exceptional imaging performance is given across the full shooting range, even close distances, by efficiently eliminating aberrations with NIKKOR Z 28mm Lens.

Super Integrated Lens Coating

A multilayer lens coating of NIKKOR Z 28mm Lens provides good transmittance across a wider wavelength range. This coating method efficiently decreases the ghost and flare effects that are common in backlit circumstances, allowing you to produce high-contrast photos with rich gradation. Nikon NIKKOR Z 35mm f/1.8 S Lens

The Nikon NIKKOR Z 35mm f/1.8 S is a versatile prime wide-angle lens with a dazzling f/1.8 maximum aperture. In addition, the optical design includes two extra-low dispersion elements and three aspherical elements, which decrease aberrations and distortion to generate pictures with great sharpness, clarity, and accurate color rendering. Nano Crystal and Super Integrated Coatings are also utilized to reduce flare and ghosting for improved color integrity and contrast. A stepping motor benefits the optics by providing rapid, quiet, and precise autofocus performance, as well as full-time manual focus override for both stills and video applications. A programmable control ring may also be configured for straightforward modification of a number of camera and exposure parameters.

f/1.8 Maximum Aperture

The prime wide-angle lens is intended for use with FX-format Z-mount mirrorless cameras. The bright f/1.8 maximum aperture of Nikon NIKKOR Z 35mm is ideal for working in low-light situations and provides greater control over depth of field for isolating subjects and working with selective focus.

Fast Autofocus

The stepping motor of Nikon NIKKOR Z 35mm lens provides smooth, quiet, and rapid focusing performance that is ideally suited to both stills and video applications. Full-time manual focus override is also available, and an internal focusing design is employed, in which only the internal lens groups are adjusted while focusing, to keep the overall length of the lens constant while in use and to encourage quicker focusing rates.

Super Integrated Lens Coating

A multilayer lens coating of Nikon NIKKOR Z 35mm Lens provides good transmittance across a wider wavelength range. Electromagnetic Aperture Mechanism

The use of a specialized electromagnetic aperture system of Nikon NIKKOR Z 35mm improves exposure control stability, which is especially useful when dealing with rapid continuous shooting rates. The rounded nine-blade diaphragm provides a pleasant out-of-focus quality, which is beneficial when using shallow depth of field and selective focus techniques.

Stabilization

This lens allows you to switch between autofocus and manual focus, and turn VR off/on from the camera menu. In the lens barrel, there is no switch. So it allows you to take a shot without the fear of accidentally changing settings.

Technology

This camera lens has used various techniques. Aspherical lenses enable a more compact design. It reduces the oberrations. The pulse motor uses to focus smoother and quieter. This system makes the lens the best lens while shooting video. Nikon AF-P camera can be a great choice in the field of photography.

full_description:
Nikon NIKKOR Z 28mm f/2.8 Lens

The Nikon NIKKOR Z 28mm f/2.8 Lens is a flexible wide-angle prime lens built especially for Nikon Z-mount mirrorless cameras in FX format. It converts effortlessly to DX-format devices, with a 42mm equivalent focal length for increased versatility. The lens's brilliant f/2.8 maximum aperture not only allows for great low-light performance, but it also adds to its overall small and portable form factor. This lens is developed with superior optical components, including two aspherical elements, to reduce spherical aberrations and distortion, delivering exceptional sharpness and precise rendering in every photo. The Super Integrated Coating significantly reduces flare and ghosting, improving contrast and color integrity, especially in low-light situations. The lens has twin stepping motors for an exceptional mix of smooth, quiet, and rapid focusing performance, making it suitable for both stills and video applications. Full-time manual focus override offers another level of control, while the internal focusing mechanism keeps the lens's overall length constant while in operation, allowing for quicker focusing rates. A one-of-a-kind Programmable regulate Ring is provided, which is originally configured to adjust manual focus but can be customized to regulate aperture or exposure compensation, giving the shooting experience a personalized touch. The unique electromagnetic aperture system improves its performance even further by providing stronger exposure control stability, which is especially useful at fast continuous shooting rates. The rounded seven-blade diaphragm adds to a beautiful out-of-focus quality, which is advantageous when using shallow depth of field and selective focus techniques. In conclusion, the Nikon NIKKOR Z 28mm f/2.8 Lens is an excellent blend of optical quality, sophisticated features, and user-friendly design, making it an excellent choice for photographers looking for a flexible and dependable wide-angle prime lens for their Nikon Z-mount mirrorless cameras.

full_description:
Nikon NIKKOR Z 40mm f/2 Lens

The Nikon NIKKOR Z 40mm f/2 is a flexible prime lens with a brilliant f/2 maximum aperture that covers both wide-angle and conventional fields of view. The focal length is distinct enough for spontaneous shooting while remaining narrow enough for portraits and selective focus shots. Furthermore, the lens's small, portable size makes it ideal for walkaround filming and equally at home on FX or DX-format camera bodies.

f/2 Maximum Aperture

The Nikon Z-mount wide-normal prime lens is designed for FX-format Nikon Z-mount mirrorless cameras but may also be used with DX-format versions, providing a 60mm equivalent focal length. The bright f/2 maximum aperture of NIKKOR Z 40mm thrives in low-light situations while also providing additional control over depth of focus for separating subjects utilizing depth of field.

Fast Autofocus

The stepping motor of Nikon NIKKOR Z 40mm provides smooth, quiet, and rapid focusing performance that is ideally suited to both stills and video applications. Full-time manual focus override is also available, and an internal focusing design is employed, in which only the internal lens groups are adjusted while focusing, to keep the overall length of the lens constant while in use and to encourage quicker focusing rates.

Super Integrated Lens Coating

The NIKKOR Z 40mm Lens's multilayer lens coating delivers high transmittance across a broader wavelength range. This coating technique effectively reduces the ghost and flare effects that are frequent in backlit situations, allowing you to obtain high-contrast photographs with rich gradation. For remarkable color balancing and reproduction capabilities, as well as superior optical performance, ghost and flare effects caused by internal reflections peculiar to digital cameras are also efficiently avoided.
